creator: suporte24

title: Used Chrome, quit due to Privacy, used Firefox, quit due to sluggishness, went to Edge, quit due to Privacy, now I am back with FF, and still same issues.
content:
1. Slow start. 2. Suddenly it stops reacting to pointer 3. Random crashes 4. Did I mention slow start, even from freshly rebooted computer?

I have used many browsers over my 30 years as IT addict and I used FF many years ago, but dropped it since it seems Mozilla might not live another 5 years. I went to Chrome by then. So seeing how Mozilla seems to thrive I went back to FF at the time I registered this account, but did not feel like the browser made any significant progress in regards to managing its sluggishness, so I left again. Then to Edge, since I am using a MS Office subscription anyways.

I reconsidered a few months ago thinking FF devs might have fixed things, but today I gave up. Unresponsive to clicking, slow update to tabs, slow startup, and overall nothing being better and some things being worse than when I left the last time. 

I depend on the browser I use, I do some developing and used maybe 20 different browser based systems, from Firewalls to Atlassian and when I feel I am not getting the performance I require to do my work, you guys have a serious problem, because: I am the user who do not keep 20-30-40+ tabs open, I do keep my systems updated, and I do not have 20+ random extensions installed. I just expect my browser to work and I do not mess with it.

I guess it is back to Edge or Chrome, that has other limitations, but they work, I will have to swallow my Privacy concerns to be able to avoid above mentioned issues.
creator: firefox1074

title: How to limit multiple process in Firefox 105.0.3 (64bit)
content:
I notice that I sometimes have as much as 14 Firefox processes running at the same time, even though I only have one tab open.

title: Opening pdf links in firefox without downloading
content:
Hi,

Till now, in the settings for pdf files i had opted to save files.

So when downloading a PDF file I will be asked where to save the file. If I was opening a URL that ends with .pdf it would simply open in firefox.

However recently this has changed. If I choose save file for a pdf it does not open any URLs that end with .pdf and ask where to save the files.

If I choose open with firefox - the URLs ending with .pdf opens in firefox, but if I want to download a pdf, I am not asked where to save it, it automatically downloads the file and then opens it in a new tab in firefox. My download settings are set to "always ask where to save files."

Earlier I could open URLs in firefox and download files to my preferred destination. Now I can only do one of these.

In other browsers, .pdf links still open and if I want to download pdf I am asked where to save the file. But in firefox this issue has come up in the last few weeks.
creator: ssg

title: *ics bestand importeren en scrollen op hol

Als ik een *ics bestand heb gedownload en importeer in mijn google agenda, blijft Firefox tabbladen openen. Ik moet de browser met de X afsluiten. Add ons: Adblocker Ultimate, Pinterest save button, Flagfox and LT (Taal tool in Nederlands).

Bovendien als ik 1 voor 1 door mijn tijdlijn scrol op Facebook begint Firefox als een dolle naar beneden te scrollen, zonder dat ik dan nog de scroll slider aanraak.

Misschien krijgen jullie meer meldingen en is dit op te lossen met een update?

title: pin tabs lost during windows update reboot
content:
Here is a suggestion for you guys.

Instead of using whatever cache files you have for pinned tabs, why not put a pinned tabs section in bookmarks so we don't have to worry about something funny eliminating the tabs. Make it easy on the user and don't force them to look for session files copy/rename, etc. Be smart.

title: Need to make Firefox stop automatically downloading PDF files.  None of the suggested fixes work.
content:
I need to know how to stop firefox from automatically downloading every PDF file I look at. I’ve tried all of the suggested fixes on Mozilla and various other sites to no avail. None of them work. I’ve tried the following:

Going into settings, downloads, and checking “Always ask you where to save files.” Didn’t work.

Going into settings, applications, and under PDF, choosing “always ask.” Didn’t work.

Going into settings, applications, and under PDF, choosing “open in firefox.” Didn’t work.

Going into about:config and changing browser.download.alwaysOpenPanel from true to false. Didn’t work

None of these fixes stopped firefox from automatically downloading pdf files. I can’t just click on a pdf file to look at it without firefox downloading it.

I’m at wit’s end. My recylcle bin is full of unwanted pdf files.

Please give me a solution that actually works. My version is 105.0.3.
creator: tamszion
